6.text: My name is Susan Hewitt and

8.text: I'm one of the three people who started the 'Love Dart' article.

12.text: What's a Love Dart? -- a Love Dart...  -- Love Dark?

17.text: The dart that Cupid shoots a person with?

23.text: there were three of us that created the first draft of it.

26.text: Never before, really in the history of humanity, have so many people come together

32.text: on a volunteer basis to build an extraordinary

36.text: resource like this that everybody can use!

39.text: So, you just write freely, and your work is edited

44.text: and improved by the other people who are working on it.

47.text: A love dart is actually a dart like a little arrow

52.text: That some land snails and slugs

55.text: make inside their body, and they use it before mating.

60.text: Each snail or slug tries to stab the other one with a love dart.

65.text: Oh my god! So that's how it happens! (laughs)

68.text: Because Cupid is a story from ancient Greece,

71.text: there might be a real parallel between

74.text: Cupid and his love darts, and the snails and their love darts.

78.text: I like Wikipedia alot, I'm a big fan -- I love Wikipedia.

82.text: When I meet other Wikipedians, inside them there's this light that comes from

86.text: building this extraordinary structure of knowledge.

90.text: I'm not a believer in 'ignorance is bliss', I think the other way around 'knowledge is power'

93.text: so I think Wikipedia is a very powerful asset for the world.

97.text: It doesn't matter what your area of specialized knowledge

101.text: there's a use for it on Wikipedia.
